s1: This course is an introduction to relational databases and the general skills for designing and using them.
s2: In this course, you will learn fundamental concepts of data communication and networking in addition to gaining a working knowledge of network scalability, mobility, security, and managing capabilities.

s1: The topics include the relational data model, SQL, entity-relationship model, functional dependencies, (de-)normalisation, relational algebra, query processing and optimisation, database transactions and security.
s2: Analyse the role of network standards, protocols, and layered models.

s1: To deepen the understanding of relational databases, the current industry development of database systems such as NoSQL databases will be introduced at the end of this course.
s2: In this course, you will learn fundamental concepts of data communication and networking in addition to gaining a working knowledge of network scalability, mobility, security, and managing capabilities.

s1: Describe the basic concepts of the relational model and understand its mathematical foundation;
s2: Analyse the role of network standards, protocols, and layered models.

s1: Use the SQL language to define, query and manipulate a relational database.
s2: Create a virtual machine and apply tools for packet analysis and file encryption in a lab environment.

s1: Apply conceptual database modelling methods such as entity-relationship model to design a relational database.
s2: Analyse the role of network standards, protocols, and layered models.

s1: Apply database design methods on functional dependencies and normal forms to evaluate the quality of a relational database design.
s2: Analyse the role of network standards, protocols, and layered models.

s1: Understand query processing and optimization, transaction and security management in a relational database management system.
s2: Create a virtual machine and apply tools for packet analysis and file encryption in a lab environment.

s1: Understand the state of the art of database management systems, and big data management challenges (Amazon's Dynamo, Google's BigTable, MongoDB and MapReduce).
s2: Networked Information Systems (NISs) are becoming an essential part of everyday experiences, in our kitchen appliances, cars, and public transport and for Internet banking and shopping.
